pr_title: Register BUILD_AND_RUN_TIME_FIXED and RUN_TIME config roots as beans

timeline.bodyText: It might be a stupid question but why a Dependent scope?
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText:
Well, we could use @Singleton but since we don't create any instance but just delegate to a static field it does not make sense to store the reference in the context. Having @Dependent means that Contextual.create() is invoked for every injetion point. In our case, Config.ApplicationConfig is read instead of context lookup (i.e. Map.get() for singleton).
And normal scopes don't make sense either. A client proxy would be useless (one more useless delegation layer).
replies.author: mkouba
